name: Login on with invalid credentials

testSteps.description: 1: Login on with invalid credentials ({username=standard_user, password=wrong_password, message=Username and password do not match any user in this service})

children.description: Given Colin is on the login page
Colin opens the https://www.saucedemo.com/

When Colin attempts to login with the following credentials:
| username | password |
| standard_user | wrong_password |
Colin logs in with username standard_user and password wrong_password
Colin enters 'standard_user' into the 'Username' field
Colin enters 'wrong_password' into the 'Password' field
Colin clicks on 'Login' button
Then he should be presented with the error message Username and password do not match any user in this service
he should see text of the 'error-message-container' element that contains: <[Username and password do not match any user in this service]>

testSteps.description: 2: Login on with invalid credentials ({username=unknown_user, password=secret_sauce, message=Username and password do not match any user in this service})

children.description: Given Colin is on the login page
Colin opens the https://www.saucedemo.com/

Colin logs in with username unknown_user and password secret_sauce
Colin enters 'unknown_user' into the 'Username' field
Colin enters 'secret_sauce' into the 'Password' field
Colin clicks on 'Login' button
Then he should be presented with the error message Username and password do not match any user in this service
he should see text of the 'error-message-container' element that contains: <[Username and password do not match any user in this service]>

testSteps.description: 4: Login on with invalid credentials ({username=locked_out_user, password=secret_sauce, message=Sorry, this user has been locked out.})

children.description: Given Colin is on the login page
Colin opens the https://www.saucedemo.com/

When Colin attempts to login with the following credentials:
| username | password |
| locked_out_user | secret_sauce |
Colin logs in with username locked_out_user and password secret_sauce
Colin enters 'locked_out_user' into the 'Username' field
Colin enters 'secret_sauce' into the 'Password' field
Colin clicks on 'Login' button
Then he should be presented with the error message Sorry, this user has been locked out.
he should see text of the 'error-message-container' element that contains: <[Sorry, this user has been locked out.]>

title: Login on with invalid credentials
